description: Brief SWOT analysis of a coastal industry, categorizing strengths, weaknesses, opportunities, and threats. Used in a tutorial to compare findings and build a comprehensive analysis. Maximum 800 words.

Two individual briefing notes: one summarizing environmental heritage and management context for a field trip (1000 words), and another preparing for a mock stakeholder workshop. Focus on structure, research, accuracy, and clarity.
Participation in a mock workshop role-playing a stakeholder. Assessed on preparation, engagement, and knowledge of coastal development issues from assigned stakeholder's perspective.

Research and write a funding proposal for a coastal resource management issue. Focus on clear articulation of issues, accurate science content, and appropriate management strategies. Part of the major project.
Develop a professional coastal management plan or communication tool based on the funding proposal. Assessed on management strategies, interdisciplinary approach, and creativity.
3-5 minute presentation to a mock panel of stakeholders on the major project. Evaluated on clarity, effectiveness, and professional delivery.
